net.java.jddac.common.type
Class TimeRepresentation

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.type.TimeRepresentation

public class TimeRepresentation
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an instant in time per 1451.1. The default timebase is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) as that is the time provided by most computer applications. However, applications (astronomical, navigational, control) may need to utilize International Atomic Time (TAI). The difference between UTC and TAI are managed such that UTC remains close to mean solar time. Leap seconds are used to establish the mapping between UTC and TAI. Leap seconds are applied at 23:59:60 on either June 30 or Decebmer 31 of years as determined by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS) at least 6 months in advance of a change. As of Jan 1, 2006, the following leap second insertions have been specified:

DateOffset   DateOffset
1972-063011   1985-063023
1972-123112   1987-123124
1973-123113   1989-123125
1974-123114   1990-123126
1975-123115   1992-063027
1976-123116   1993-063028
1977-123117   1994-063029
1978-123118   1995-123130
1979-123119   1997-063031
1981-0603020   1998-123132
1982-0603021   2005-123133
1983-0603022     
Systems that only support UTC and are not TAI aware should set the leap offset to zero which will serve as an indicator to TAI aware systems that conversion to TAI will need to utilize a conversion table. A default conversion table is included in this implementation that assumes an offset of 33 for any time after Jan 1, 2006. Implementations that are TAI aware of leap seconds beyond 2005 should set the defaultLeapSeconds value as well as providing a conversion table.
